hook.text: Neoconservatives believed America should spread democracy â€” by force if necessary. Iraq tested the theory.

buildup.text: Neoconservatism emerged from former leftists who turned hawkish on foreign policy in the Cold War era.

discovery.text: Key neocons like Wolfowitz and Kristol argued that American military power should reshape the Middle East.

twist.text: The Iraq War discredited the movement. Spreading democracy through invasion created chaos, not freedom.

climax.text: Neoconservatism faded after Iraq. Populist conservatives now reject nation-building and foreign intervention.

punchline.text: Neocons wanted to export democracy. Iraq showed force doesn't deliver it.

quiz.question: What event discredited neoconservatism?
options: The Iraq War and its chaotic aftermath
The fall of the Berlin Wall
